title: By selling a towel for 126.90, a draper loses 6%. For how much should he sell the towel to gain 4%? - Quora

response.answer_text: When the towel is sold at 126.90, % of the loss : 6% If so, the cost (purchase price) : (126.90/94) x 100 = 135 Selling price to gain 4% : 135 + 4% of 135 = 135 + 5.40 = 140.40
S.p=126.90 L%=6 C.p=126.90(100/94) =Upon simplification 135 Now g%=4 S.p=135(104/100) Upon simplification,₹ 140.40
Let the cost be 100x At 6% loss , sale price = 94x At 4% gain , sale price = 104x 94x = 126.90 104x = ? 104/96 X 126.90 = Rs 137.48 ANSWER
